medical_history.chief_complaint: Surgical site infection with recurrent breakdown of scalp wound unresponsive to prescribed antibiotics.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient underwent anterior cranial expansion surgery in July 2001. Recurrent breakdown of the scalp wound occurred two months later, requiring subsequent debridement and grafting. After initial treatment with vancomycin, the infection resolved but recurred leading to readmission and further surgical intervention. By day 10 of clindamycin therapy, wound drainage and breakdown had progressed significantly.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Crouzon syndrome; Surgical history of anterior cranial expansion.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother had a surgical wound infection caused by MRSA during the same time period.
